notes: Irene was premiered in the Burgtheater on 21 Jan 1781, and performed only three times before being dropped.

"Präsentirt das Gewehr L. / 2. A. Die Matrosen."Präsentirt das Gewehr had been in the repertory of the court theater since 17 Jun 1775, but this performance in the Kärntnertortheater is not in Hadamowsky.
"Präsentirt das Gewehr L. / 2. A. Die Matrosen."Not specified whether this is actually the "Matrosen Ballet" of earlier in the month.
"Die schöne Schusterinn / S. in 2. A. a. d. Fr."
"La Rosiere de Salency O. / 3. A. et Ballet."A German version, Das Rosenfest zu Salenci, has been in the repertory of the court theater company since 9 Sep 1779.
"Musikalische Akademie zum Vortheil der Herrn Winter und Tausch. In Churbayer. Diensten."Cf. 26 Mar
"Wahrheit ist gut Ding / L. in 5. A. / nach dem Lügner d. Gold. / frey bearbeitet v. Schle= / ter."
"Babier [sic] de Seville O. [sic] 4. A. / La belle Cordoniere. O. / 2. A."
"Babier [sic] de Seville O. [sic] 4. A. / La belle Cordoniere. O. / 2. A."May be Les souliers mors-dorés, ou La cordonniere allemande (see work record).
"Die kleine Näscherinn. L. / 1. A. die Horazier. B."Probably = to "Die Näscherinn"?
Earliest Viennese performance in Hadamowsky on 5 Apr 1769 in the Kärntnertortheater.
"Ermine [sic] v. Steinheim / Tr. im 5. A. v. Blum= / auer."
Hadamowsky has a production by the court theater premiering on 27 Jun 1809.
"Musikalische Akademie. zum Vortheil Herrn. Schlick. K. M. aus Gotha und Herrn Tanner aus München."
Only performance in 1781. First performed in Vienna in 1770.
Premiere in the Burgtheater on 26 Jul 1780
Premiere. Performed only one more time on 21 Feb before being permanently dropped.

"Musikalische Akadamie zum Vortheil Hr. Anton Ulbrich, von WIen.""Anton" may have been either Anton Ignaz Ulbrich (1706–1796) or his son Anton Johann Nepomuk (1754–1830), both trombonists. Neither is known to have composed. One wonders whether this might have been a family concert, perhaps also including Johann Nepomuk Maximilian (1743–1814), who was a composer.

Zinzendorf attended this performance and that of Der eifersüchtige Liebhaber. It was his first attendance of a public theatrical performances since his return from Trieste."♃. 22. Fevrier. [...] Dela au Spectacle national. D[as] WinterQuartier in America. La Jaquet, jolie actrice. Der eifersüchtige Liebhaber opera comique françois traduit. belle musique. Adamberger chanta bien. La Lang qui est grosse point parfaitement, Vischer bien. L'air de Alonso Sans jalousie point d'amour. J'etois avec M:e de Thun dans la loge du C:te Rosenberg."
This was Monzani's only known appearance in Vienna
"Hr. Autors Einnahme."This was the third performance, and the proceeds went to Stephanie d. J.Zinendorf attempted to go to this performance, but couldn't find a seat.
"Musikalische Akademie. / Zum Vortheil Hr. Adambergers Mitglied d. K. K. / N. H. Schaubühne."
"Dergleichen z. V. Hr. Thurners, M. d. Orchest. b. Nationaltheater."Mathias Thurner was a flutist in the orchestra of the court orchestra in Vienna; see Steblin, JAMIS 2008.
"Dergleichen z. V. der Unternehmer des Franz. Schauspiels."
"Dergleichen z. V. der Tonkünstler Gesellschaft allhier. Alcid am Scheidwege."Hasse's Alcide al bivio
"Wie am Sonntag den 11. d. M."Hasse's Alcide al bivio

"Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Boruwlaski in Königl. Pohlnischen / Diensten."See Boruwłaski's description of his visit to Vienna in 1781 and his concert in his autobiography, 159ffMorrow (249) notes that the concert is in Zinzendorf, who mentions a guitar player and Adamberger
"Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Righini, gen. Apolls Geburtstag."= Il natale di Apollo
"Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Ramms in Churbayer. Diensten."

"Dergleichen / z. V. der Madame Mara."In Schletter, the date appears as "Dienstag / d. a2. [sic]"MBA, iii:101, Wolfgang to Leopold, 24 Mar:"die Mara ist hier; – sie hat vergangen dienstag eine accademie im Theater gegeben. – ihr Mann hat sich nicht dürfen sehen lassen, sonst hätte das orchstre nicht accompagnirt, weil er in die Zeitungen gedruckt hat, i ganz Wien seye kein Mensch im stande ihm zu accompagniren."
Reprise of Il natale di Apollo
"Dergleichen / z. V. Hr. Winter und Tausch, in Churbayer. / Diensten."Cf. 2 Feb
"Dergleichen / z. V. der Madame Olivieri."Madame Olivieri not yet identified

"Dergleichen / z. V. der Madam Varennes."In ZinzendorfMadame Varenne played in concerts at the French ambassador's on 24 Mar, 28 Mar, 7 Apr, and 5 May 1781 (on 7 Apr with "Herr Varene", violin), and on 4 Apr at Prince Paar.
Albrechtsberger's Die Pilgrime auf Golgatha was performed.
Albrechtsberger's Die Pilgrime auf Golgatha was performed.A Mozart symphony was performed and he played the piano.
Zinendorf attended this premiere, calling it a "mauvaise tragedie", noting, however, "Schroeder qui fit le rôle du Duc Albert de Bavière, joua comme un ange."
This performance was attended by the Emperor, Archduchesses Maria Anna, Maria, and Maria Elisabeth, and Duke Albert von Sachsen-Teschen (WZ, Sat, 21 Apr 1781, no. 32, [6]
Zinzendorf attended this performance, writing "Belle musique."

This performance in the Burgtheater is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Because it took place on a Friday, it may have been a benefit. Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen" on this day."Wissenschaft. geht vor / Schonheit [sic]. / L. in 3. A. n. G. v. B."
Performed only four times before being dropped.
Zinzendorf attended this performance, writing: "Je trouvois Schroeter excellent en vieillard, jeu noble, [debit] agréable."
"L'Offcier & le grand Baillif. C. 5. / la Laitiere. C. 1. a."Identification of "La Laitiere" as the work by Anseaume and Duni is provisional.
Performed only four times before being dropped.
Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Possibly a benefit.
"Musikalische Akademie / z. V. Hr. Johann Lausch."

Zinzendorf attended these performances: "Le soir au Theatre de la porte de Carinthie. L'Homme comme il y en a peu. Dalainval, Calet et le jolie M:elle Laurens jouerent fort bien. La Servante maitresse bien jouée et mal chantée."
On Zinzendorf's reaction, see the preceding entry.
Zinzendorf attended this performance: "Le soir au Spectacle der flatterhaffte Liebhaber [sic]. Schroeter y joua a merveille en pauvre rôle [...]"
Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschollsen" on this day.
Premiere on the same day as the last of three performances of Eckardt's Die Schwäger. Performed only three times.

"Der Eßighandler. / L. in 3. A. a. d. Fr."Adapted from Mercier's La Brouette du vinaigrier.Zinzendorf attended these peformances: "Le soir au Theatre. der Wein Eßig Händler. mauvais pièce que Schroeter rendit tres suportable par son jeu excellent. Ariadne zu Naxos Ein melodrama. M:e Schroeter tres bien [****], joua assez bien. L'orage a merveille."

"Dupuis & des Ronæls.C. / 3. a."This title only in Bender (based on Schletter). Schinke has "Depuis & de Ronais".
Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen."
Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen."

Zinzendorf attended this performance: "Andromede melodrame musique de M. Zimmer,ann. M:e Sacco joua comme un ange. le mot de Wahrheit quelle expression elle lui donna, en [***]ant a Persée qu'elle l'aime."
Zinzendorf attended these perfromances: "Au Spectac;le françois. L'homme officieux, puis Nanette et Lucas."
"La Soiree a la Mode. C. 1. a."
Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps a Friday benefit. Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen" on this day.

Sartori:	Matteo Gervasi, composer of La Mistica vittoria (1772)	Giuseppe Gervasoni, a singer active in the early 1780s	Susanna Gervasio, singerGerber 1790, only name even close is Mr. Gervais, violinist who appeared at the Concert spirituel in Paris.There was a tenor Cesare Cervasi in the 1820s
Probably with Schröder in the title role?
Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps a Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen"  on this day.
Not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna. Perhaps a Friday benefit? Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater as "geschlossen"  on this day.
First performed in Paris for the first time 14 Nov 1780. Adapted from a "conte philosophique" by Voltaire (1764)

"Musikalische Akademie z. V. v. Mrs. Agostinelli.""Mrs." is probably "Monsieur," based on Schletter's apparent usage. There is a soprano Angela (Angelica) Agostinelli in Sartori in libretti from 1765 to 1767."Agostinelli" not in Gerber 1790 or Morrow. See Bernardini 1988, on the Venetian oboist/flutist Floravante Agostinelli (1741–1809). See his note 12. Alternate first names are "Francesco Saverio" and "Florante". He was employed by the Thurn und Taxis court for 32 years. Burney heard him in Ludwigsburg in 1772.Often referred to (Badley, Murray, Powell) as "Florante"
"Milton und Elmire / A. v. Göthe. Ballet."Schletter may have confused Milton und Elmire with Goethe's Erwin und Elmire, which had been in the repertory of the court theater since 1776.
Confusion over multiple works with this or related titles.
German version of Le due contesse, which had been performed in Vienna in 1776 and 1777.
"Les Dupes. O. 1. a."Uncertain whether this work, listed as an opera, is the same as La Comédie à l'impromptu, ou les Dupes performed by the French company in July.
Hadamowsky has Die Widersprecherin on this date
This work and performance is not in Hadamowsky.

The directors of the French company absconded from Vienna on 8 Sep 1781 because of the company's poor finances. The company chose Le Petit as in interim internal director. They were allowed to continue their performances, but the emperor resolved on 8 Sep: “aber ihre Effecten, die vermutlich denen Entrepreneurs gehörten, sind für die Schuldner in Beschlag zu nehmen" (Hadamowsky, 464).
This performance, on a Friday, is not in Hadamowsky or Von Alth/Obzyna/
From the 1781 Viennese libretto: "Aufgeführt auf dem k. k. Hof=Nationaltheater von der in der Schauspielkunst sich übenden Jugend."
Possibly a benefit for composer Peter Winter, who seems still to have been in Vienna?
Performed just three times in 1781, and revived for two performances in 1785.

Entry to the theater was free in celebration of the news of Marie Antoinette's successful delivery of a male child and potential heir to the French throne, Louis-Joseph de France, on 22 Oct 1781. (Louis-Joseph died on 4 Jun 1789.)
Das Landmädchen was in the repertory of the court theater company. This free performance in the Kärntnertortheater is not in Hadamowsky.

Free in celebration of the news of Marie Antoinette's successful delivery of a male child and potential heir to the French throne, Louis-Joseph de France, on 22 Oct 1781. (Louis-Joseph died on 4 Jun 1789.)
Hadamowsky has the Burgtheater closed on this day. The earliest performance of Der Furchtsame in Hadamowsky was on 1 Sep 1764, and the latest on 19 Jan 1779.
First performed by the court theater in Vienna on 1 Oct 1778.
Perhaps given by the Theaterschule? No Viennese playbook in the ÖNB.

"L'impro di Coeur a l'occas. / de la Naissance de Mgr. le Dauphine." The reference is to the potential heir to the French throne, Louis-Joseph de France, born on 22 Oct 1781. (Louis-Joseph died on 4 Jun 1789.)
This performance is missing in Hadamowsky.
Not specified as being done by the Kindertheater, but Präsentirt das Gewehr was in their repertoire.
The program of this concert is known from a surviving poster.
Hadamowsky has a performance of Der Weise in der That as early as 14 May 1768, and it had been in the repertory of the Nationaltheater since 2 Jul 1776.

Tenor Giorgio Crinazzi (1750–1782) was in Vienna by the early months of 1781, where he was the singing teacher of the daughters of Leopold von Auenbrugger. On 23 Jun 1781 he signed a four-month contract with the Esterházy kapelle, but fell ill and returned to Vienna in the fall. He died in Vienna on 31 Dec 1782. See https://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Giorgio_Crinazzi (which cites no sources).
Mademoiselle Hauck's second concert in the Kärntnertortheater was previously unknown.
